that is, 
\begin{align*}
X_{i} & =\left(\text{price}_{i}\text{(Jan20\ensuremath{^{\text{th}}})}-\text{price}_{i}\text{(Dec 16\ensuremath{^{\text{th}}})}\right)/\text{price}_{i}\text{(Dec 16\ensuremath{^{\text{th}}})}\\
Y_{i} & =\left(\text{price}_{i}\text{(Feb 17\ensuremath{^{\text{th}}})}-\text{price}_{i}\text{(Dec 16\ensuremath{^{\text{th}}})}\right)/\text{price}_{i}\text{(Dec 16\ensuremath{^{\text{th}}})}\\
i & =1\text{(Amazon)},2\text{(Apple)}
\end{align*}
\begin{align*}
X_{i} & =\left(\text{price}_{i}(01/20)\text{price\ensuremath{}Jan 20\ensuremath{^{\text{th}}}}-\text{Amazon Dec 16\ensuremath{^{\text{th}}}}\right)/\text{Amazon Dec 16\ensuremath{^{\text{th}}}}\\
X_{2} & =\left(\text{Apple Jan 20\ensuremath{^{\text{th}}}}-\text{Apple Dec 16\ensuremath{^{\text{th}}}}\right)/\text{Apple Dec 16\ensuremath{^{\text{th}}}}\\
Y_{1} & =\left(\text{Amazon Feb 17\ensuremath{^{\text{th}}}}-\text{Amazon Dec 16\ensuremath{^{\text{th}}}}\right)/\text{Amazon Dec 16\ensuremath{^{\text{th}}}}\\
Y_{2} & =\left(\text{Apple Feb 17\ensuremath{^{\text{th}}}}-\text{Apple Dec 16\ensuremath{^{\text{th}}}}\right)/\text{Apple Dec 16\ensuremath{^{\text{th}}}}
\end{align*}
